0.title: Integrated command-control centre in all smart cities by Aug 15: Puri
0.article_body: Housing and Urban Affairs Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Monday said 80 out of 100 Smart Cities in India have Integrated Command and Control Centres and the remaining cities will get it by August 15. "Work has started in almost all government-funded projects [under] the Smart Cities Mission (SCM) and [the] projects...will be completed by next year," Puri added.

1.title: Twitter board members' salary will be $0 if I acquire the company: Musk
1.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk said on Monday that Twitter's board of directors will not receive any compensation if he succeeds in acquiring the company. "Board salary will be $0 if my bid succeeds, so that's ~$3 million/year saved right there," he tweeted. Twitter currently spends about $2.9 million in cash and stock awards to board members, as per filings.

2.title: Who is India's new Army chief Lieutenant General Manoj Pande?
2.article_body: Lieutenant General Manoj Pande will take charge as the 29th chief of the Army Staff in India. An alumnus of the National Defence Academy, Khadakwasla and the Indian Military Academy, Dehradun, Pande has a military career spanning nearly 40 years. He has commanded an engineer brigade along the LoC in J&K during Operation Parakram (during the 2001-2002 India-Pakistan standoff).

3.title: Anil forced Boney to give me hike in 'Woh 7 Din': Satish Kaushik
3.article_body: Actor Satish Kaushik has revealed that actor Anil Kapoor forced his brother producer Boney Kapoor to give him ₹501 from his earlier decided fee of ₹201 in 1983 film 'Woh 7 Din'. "The first day of shoot I had to wear a shirt. Anil brought one and said...Rishi Kapoor had worn it in 'Phool Khile Hain Gulshan Gulshan'," he added.

4.title: Lifetime chance for youngsters: Anand on 100-day countdown to Chess Olympiad
4.article_body: Marking the 100-day countdown for 44th Chess Olympiad, to be held in Chennai, on Monday, five-time world chess champion Viswanathan Anand said the tournament is a life-time opportunity for youngsters to catch a glimpse of their idols. "Watch them play and possibly interact with them," he added. The Olympiad will be held from July 28 to August 10.

5.title: Sayani Gupta, Tamannaah wear same saree at Iftaar party, share pics
5.article_body: Actresses Sayani Gupta and Tamannaah Bhatia on Sunday turned up in the same saree designed by Monica Shah and Karishma Swali's brand Jade at Baba Siddiqui's Iftaar party. Sayani took to Instagram Stories to share pictures with Tamannaah, writing, "Tamannaah and I were twinning. Thanks @jady_bymk for giving us the same outfits. Had to take photos."

6.title: It started in my 30s: Jennifer Aniston on battling insomnia
6.article_body: Actress Jennifer Aniston has revealed that she battles with insomnia and said that it started in her 30s. "I dread spending another night counting cracks in the walls...And the more I worry about it [sleeping]...harder it is to fall asleep," she told the People magazine. Jennifer further said she used to sleepwalk, however, added she doesn't do it anymore.

7.title: Rise in private debt due to COVID-19 may affect growth over 3 yrs: IMF
7.article_body: A chapter of the International Monetary Fund's (IMF) World Economic Outlook said debt accumulated by the private sector during the COVID-19 pandemic could lower growth for emerging markets by 1.3% over three years. For developed nations, growth is expected to be reduced by 0.9%. IMF had earlier forecasted advanced and emerging markets to grow at 3.9% and 4.8% in 2022.

8.title: Ultimately, nobody will be able to pay more for talent than TCS: CEO
8.article_body: Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) CEO Rajesh Gopinathan called the current scramble for employees "transitory" and argued that, ultimately, nobody will be able to pay more for talent than TCS, Bloomberg reported. He said that TCS enjoys the highest structural margins. "We enjoy the benefit of occupying the high point on the profitability side...everybody else is benchmarked below us," he added.

9.title: World Bank cuts global growth forecast to 3.2% due to Ukraine war
9.article_body: World Bank President David Malpass on Monday said the bank has cut its global growth forecast for 2022 from 4.1% to 3.2% owing to the Russia-Ukraine war. Forecasts are being cut for advanced and many developing economies because of spikes in food, energy prices, Malpass said. World Bank is also proposing a new, 15-month crisis financing target of $170 billion.

10.title: Railway police officer killed, another injured in terror attack in J&K
10.article_body: A Railway Protection Force Head Constable was killed and an Assistant Sub-Inspector injured after terrorists opened fire at them in Jammu and Kashmir's Pulwama district on Monday, officials said. The incident took place near a tea stall in Kakapora area. After the attack, Head Constable Surinder Singh and ASI Devraj were taken to a hospital where Singh was declared dead.

11.title: 27-year-old Iñaki Williams goes 6 years without missing a La Liga match
11.article_body: Athletic Club forward Iñaki Williams has now gone six years without missing a La Liga match. The 27-year-old Spanish footballer achieved the feat after being named in starting XI for Sunday's La Liga match against Celta Vigo. He has now played 227 La Liga matches in a row. He holds the record for most consecutive appearances in La Liga.

12.title: I haven't replied to Congress' show-cause notice: Sunil Jakhar
12.article_body: Ex-Punjab Congress chief Sunil Jakhar on Monday said he hasn't replied to the show-cause notice issued to him by the Congress disciplinary committee. The notice was issued on April 11 for going against "party line" and using "objectionable words" for the Dalit community. Jakhar has denied making any statement against the community saying his remarks were put "out of context".

13.title: Man with knife arrested after confronting police near UK PM's home
13.article_body: The UK Police on Monday said that they've arrested a 29-year-old man armed with a knife who confronted two Ministry of Defence police officers near British PM's official residence in London. The incident isn't being treated as terror-related, it added. "He was arrested on suspicion of attempted murder and...remains in custody at a central London police station," it further said.

14.title: Cycle theft accused dies in custody in Odisha, family alleges torture
14.article_body: A cycle theft accused from Odisha's Bhubaneswar, who died in police custody after being arrested on Sunday, was allegedly tortured, his family has claimed. The deceased's wife said she found her husband dead after being asked to come to the hospital late at night. "If...police nabbed my husband at 7.30 pm, why did they inform...at 1.30 am," his wife said.

15.title: Minor girl, man found hanging from tree in Punjab's Ferozepur
15.article_body: The bodies of a minor girl and a man were found hanging from a tree in a village in Punjab's Ferozepur on Monday. The bodies were first spotted at around 7.30 am by local residents who then informed the police. A motorcycle that was parked nearby has been impounded and the bodies have been sent for post-mortem.

16.title: Gold prices jump to 1-month high amid Russia-Ukraine war, inflation concerns
16.article_body: Gold prices jumped to more than one-month high on Monday amid concerns over economic fallout from Russia-Ukraine war and surging inflation. Spot gold rose 0.9% to $1,991.51 per ounce. Among other metals, spot silver rose 1% to $25.93 per ounce, whereas Platinum climbed 1.8%. Bullion is considered a safe store of value during times of political and economic crisis.

17.title: US official to visit Solomon Islands amid concerns over China pact
17.article_body: The White House on Monday said that US Indo-Pacific Coordinator Kurt Campbell will visit the Solomon Islands this week, amid concerns about the potential security pact between the island country and China. Earlier, Australia's Minister for the Pacific had visited the country to discuss the proposed security pact. The agreement would allow China to deploy its military in the region.

18.title: 2 captured Britons come on Russian state TV, ask to be swapped with Putin ally
18.article_body: Two British soldiers captured in Ukraine by Russian forces appeared on Russian state TV on Monday and asked to be exchanged for an ally of Vladimir Putin known as the 'Prince of darkness'. Shaun Pinner and Aiden Aslin appealed to UK PM Boris Johnson to negotiate their release in exchange for Viktor Medvedchuk, a Ukrainian politician who's close to Putin.

19.title: Maha govt must ban leaders' rallies who create communal tensions: Patole
19.article_body: Congress' Nana Patole said on Monday that the Maharashtra government must ban public rallies of political leaders who try to create communal tensions. Patole's remark comes a day after Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) chief Raj Thackeray announced that he'll conduct a rally in Aurangabad on May 1. Thackeray had earlier demanded the removal of loudspeakers from mosques by May 3.

20.title: Islamic body moves SC against bulldozing houses of riot accused
20.article_body: Islamic body Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind has moved Supreme Court seeking appropriate direction to states against demolishing houses of accused in cases of violence. This comes after Madhya Pradesh government used bulldozers to raze down houses of persons accused of rioting during a Ram Navami procession in Khargone. The petitioner said resorting to such measures is clearly against constitutional ethos.

21.title: Nadal trains for first time in a month since Indian Wells final, shares pic
21.article_body: Twenty-one time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal took to Twitter to share a photo of himself training for the first time since losing in Indian Wells Masters last month. "Today after four weeks without stepping on a tennis court, first light training. What an illusion to step on the earth again!" he wrote. Nadal had injured his rib in semi-final.

22.title: I always found it tough to bowl to Sehwag in IPL: KKR spinner Narine
22.article_body: Ahead of his 150th IPL match, KKR spinner Sunil Narine was asked who he thinks played him the best in IPL, to which he replied Virender Sehwag. "I always found it tough because he was a guy who always kept the game going no matter what situation the team was in, he kept batting the way he did," he added.

23.title: Provide COVID-19 data daily: Centre as Kerala reports data after 5-day gap
23.article_body: Union Health Ministry has written a letter to Kerala Principal Secretary Rajan Khobragade, asking him to ensure updating COVID-19 data daily as the state reported its data after five days since April 13. ''Daily and diligent reporting of data is critical to arrive at a meaningful understanding of the pandemic in districts, state and national level," the ministry added.

24.title: Kangana is Brahmastra in reality show 'Lock Upp': Tusshar Kapoor
24.article_body: Actor Tusshar Kapoor has stated that ALT Balaji has launched a Brahmastra in the form of actress Kangana Ranaut as a host on reality show 'Lock Upp'. "She's the perfect person to host the show. Her frank attitude...courageous nature and the confidence with which she tells people their truth or judges them...is very fair and very real," the actor added.

25.title: KKR to bowl first against RR, RR make three changes to their playing XI
25.article_body: Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR) captain Shreyas Iyer won the toss and elected to bowl first against Rajasthan Royals (RR) in their IPL 2022 clash on Monday. KKR have made one change to their playing XI, with Shivam Mavi replacing Aman Khan. RR have included Karun Nair, Obed McCoy and Trent Boult in their playing XI.

26.title: Previous govts left Punjab with a debt of ₹3 lakh crore: CM Mann
26.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Monday blamed state's previous governments for its debt. "Previous governments...left a debt of ₹3 lakh crore on Punjab. But where has this loan been used? We'll investigate and recover [the amount],” AAP's Punjab unit tweeted quoting Mann. Notably, Mann sought financial package of ₹1 lakh crore for state from PM Narendra Modi after assuming charge.

27.title: 8-yr-old boy found dead in Pune's Chikhali, murder probe launched
27.article_body: An 8-year-old boy was found dead with a "fatal injury inflicted with a blunt hard object" at a tin shed in Pune's Chikhali on Sunday, police said. His family had lodged a missing complaint when he didn't return home for a long time following which a search was launched. We've registered a murder case and launched a probe, police added.

28.title: Pressure is at its highest: Zaheer on MI's 6-match losing streak
28.article_body: MI Director of Cricket Operations Zaheer Khan said that the pressure level is "at its highest" for the team as they've lost six consecutive matches in ongoing IPL. "This is a team sport so we have to stick together, have to find ways of coming together and then become a force," he stated. It's MI's worst start in IPL history.

29.title: Don't remember last time I saw damsel in distress on screen: Avantika
29.article_body: Actress Avantika Dassani has stated that she doesn't remember the last time she saw a damsel in distress on the screen. "Everyone keeps asking me this question and I ask them the last time they saw it too," she added. The actress further said that she doesn't want to limit herself to anything, adding that all experiences are welcome.

30.title: Hardik has absolutely thrived in captaincy role for GT in IPL: Kirsten
30.article_body: Praising Hardik Pandya for leading GT in IPL 2022, batting coach Gary Kirsten said Hardik is a class and has absolutely thrived in the new role of a captain. "He's a fantastic batter...can play in a lot of different ways...he's played with great maturity," Kirsten added. GT are currently on top of standings, winning five of six matches so far.

31.title: Turkey launches military operation against Kurdish militants in Iraq
31.article_body: Turkey on Monday announced the launch of a new ground and air cross-border military operation against Kurdish militants in northern Iraq. The jets successfully struck shelters, bunkers, caves, tunnels, ammunition depots and headquarters belonging to the militants, the Turkish Defence Minister said. At least 19 Kurdish militants were killed and about four Turkish soldiers were injured, he added.

32.title: Speculative in nature: Mindtree on report of $22 bn merger with L&T Infotech
32.article_body: Mindtree on Monday clarified that news reports of its merger with Larsen & Toubro Infotech are "speculative in nature". Mindtree said, "We would like to state that there is no information available with the company as of today." Bloomberg earlier reported that Larsen & Toubro is considering a merger between the two software firms to create a $22 billion firm.

33.title: What is 'pyramid fraud' that Amway India is accused of running?
33.article_body: The ED accused Amway India of running a 'pyramid fraud' and provisionally attached its assets worth ₹757.77 crore. It alleged Amway of running a pyramid fraud in the guise of direct selling multi-level marketing network and exorbitant pricing of products. "Gullible public is induced to join as members and purchase products at exorbitant prices, losing their hard-earned money," ED said.

34.title: Fati was born to score goals, he reminds me of Samuel Eto'o: Alves
34.article_body: Barcelona player Dani Alves has said that forward Ansu Fati reminds him of former Barcelona forward Samuel Eto'o. "Fati was born to score goals...He is a machine for destroying defences. I think he can also define an era, a special history within Barcelona," Dani added. Fati donned the number 10 jersey after Lionel Messi's departure from the club.

35.title: Lt Gen Manoj Pande appointed Indian Army chief, 1st engineer to hold the post
35.article_body: Lieutenant General Manoj Pande was on Monday appointed as the new chief of the Indian Army. He's the first engineer to hold the post. Pande, who was appointed Vice Chief of the Army Staff in February 2022, will succeed General MM Naravane as Army chief. A decision on the appointment of the Chief of Defence Staff is reportedly still pending.

36.title: Investors lose ₹2.5 lakh crore wealth in a day as Sensex crashes 1,170 points
36.article_body: Nearly ₹2.5 lakh crore was wiped off investors' wealth on Monday as Sensex plunged 1,172 points to settle at 57,166 amid weak global cues. The market capitalisation of BSE-listed companies dropped to ₹269.48 lakh crore from ₹ 272.12 lakh crore in the previous session. Infosys, HDFC, HDFC Bank, Tech Mahindra, Wipro and TCS were among the top losers on Monday.

37.title: Central Railway organises unique light & sound show at Mumbai's CSMT
37.article_body: Central Railway organised a unique light and sound show at the Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus (CSMT) heritage building on Sunday to commemorate entering 170th year of Indian Railways. The show was titled 'Navarasangam - ek gatha CSMT ki'. It also commemorated the World Heritage Day, Railway Week and Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav, a celebration of 75 years of India's independence.

38.title: Real Madrid's Benzema is exceptional: Man City manager Pep Guardiola
38.article_body: Ahead of the Champions League semifinal fixture against Real Madrid, Manchester City manager Pep Guardiola has said that Real Madrid forward Karim Benzema is exceptional. "Benzema is not only a scorer but is a fantastic all-round player. His career is phenomenal," Guardiola added. In the ongoing Champions League season, Benzema has scored 12 goals in nine games played so far.

39.title: Kejriwal to visit Bengaluru on April 21, attend farmers' convention
39.article_body:
Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal will visit Bengaluru on April 21 and attend a convention of farmers on the invitation of Karnataka Rajya Raitha Sangha chief and farmer leader Kodihalli Chandrashekhar. 
AAP's Karnataka Convener Prithvi Reddy said the party is the platform for people who fight for farmers' cause. He said AAP wants to get such people elected to Vidhana Soudha.

40.title: Govt registered highest-ever 1.67 lakh companies in FY22, up 8% YoY
40.article_body: Corporate Affairs Ministry registered over 1.67 lakh companies incorporations in FY22, an 8% YoY increase from 1.55 lakh companies incorporations registered in FY21. This is the highest number of company incorporations in a financial year till date. The Ministry said it has taken many initiatives for reducing the number of procedures, time and cost for starting a business in India.

41.title: Goa CM should withdraw comments on 'religious conversion': Cong leader
41.article_body: Congress' Michael Lobo reacted to Goa CM Pramod Sawant's comments on 'religious conversion', stating that Sawant should withdraw the "unwarranted" remarks. "[Sawant's] trying to polarise one section of the society...[he] needs to take everyone along," Lobo added. Sawant had said that Goa government will never allow religious conversions in the state, adding that people should be vigilant about it.

42.title: If philanthropy is love of humanity, my companies are philanthropy: Musk
42.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk said SpaceX, Tesla, Neuralink and The Boring Company, the companies that he has founded, are philanthropy. "If you say philanthropy is love of humanity, they are philanthropy," Musk added. Asked about his views on billionaire philanthropy, he said, "If you care about reality of goodness instead of the perception of it, philanthropy is extremely difficult."

43.title: Noida parents protest school fee hike by polishing shoes
43.article_body: A group of parents in Greater Noida on Sunday polished shoes on the roadside as a symbolic gesture to protest against the hike in fees by private schools. The protest comes despite a UP government order that allowed the schools to hike their fees. The protestors have appealed to the CM to withdraw the order to make education more accessible.

44.title: Pics show final moments of Russian warship after being hit by Ukrainian missiles
44.article_body: Pictures and footage purportedly showing the final moments of the Russian warship Moskva that sank after being hit by two Ukrainian missiles, have been widely shared online. The ship went down in the Black Sea last week after Ukraine said it launched two Neptune missiles. Russia had, however, cited stormy seas as the reason, which the pictures seem to contradict.

45.title: Which cricketers from inaugural IPL match 14 years ago are still playing in IPL?
45.article_body: The first-ever IPL match took place on April 18, 2008 between KKR and RCB. KKR were led by Sourav Ganguly, while RCB were captained by Rahul Dravid. Virat Kohli and Wriddhiman Saha, who are playing in IPL 2022, also featured in the first-ever IPL match. Saha, who made his GT debut on Sunday, represented KKR in the inaugural match.

46.title: NASA shares picture of sunrise on Mars
46.article_body: NASA has shared a picture of the sunrise on Mars captured by its InSight lander. "On April 10, 2022, the 1198th sol (or Martian day) of its mission, our InSight lander took this photo of Martian dawn on the plains of Elysium Planitia," NASA said. InSight is NASA's first mission to study the interior of Mars in depth.

47.title: I'm happy South films are breaking into new territories: Anil Kapoor
47.article_body: Anil Kapoor said that the South has always been making "exceptional" films and added he is "happy" that South films are breaking into new territories. "I started my career with films down south and it gives me immense pleasure to see them doing so good," he stated. This comes after 'RRR', and 'Pushpa: The Rise' were commercial successes across India.

48.title: Ukraine has completed questionnaire for EU membership: Official
48.article_body: Ukraine has completed a questionnaire that will form the starting point for the European Union (EU) to consider the country's membership in the bloc, Ihor Zhovkva, Deputy Head of President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's Office, said. Ukraine expects to acquire candidate country status for accession to the EU in June, Zhovkva added. Ukraine signed an application to join the EU in February.

49.title: Shocking and saddening: PM Modi on the demise of 18-year-old TT player Vishwa
49.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday tweeted, "The demise of TT champion Vishwa Deenadayalan is shocking and saddening." The 18-year-old table tennis player from Tamil Nadu died in a road accident on Sunday while travelling from Guwahati to Shillong for the 83rd Senior National and Inter-State Table Tennis Championship. PM Modi said Vishwa had distinguished himself in several competitions.

50.title: Who is Jammu fruit seller's son Umran Malik, the fastest Indian bowler in IPL 2022?
50.article_body: SRH pacer Umran Malik, the fastest Indian bowler in IPL 2022, was born on November 22, 1999 in Jammu and Kashmir. His father is a fruit seller. Umran was SRH's net bowler in IPL 2021 and he replaced T Natarajan in main squad after the latter was ruled out due to COVID-19. He was retained by SRH for ₹4 crore.

51.title: Never ever get a tattoo: Samantha to fan despite having 3 tattoos
51.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu held an 'ask me anything' session on Instagram Stories during which a fan asked for tattoo suggestions. The actress responded, "You know the one thing I'd tell my younger self is never ever get a tattoo. Never. Never ever. Ever, get a tattoo."  Samantha reportedly has three tattoos connected to her ex-husband Naga Chaitanya.

52.title: Training aircraft of pvt flying school topples on runway, 1 injured
52.article_body: A training aircraft of a private flying school toppled during landing at the Jakkur Aerodrome in Bengaluru on Sunday evening. An international skydiving champion, who was on the aircraft, received minor injuries as she was rescued by the pilot. The pilot reportedly spotted dogs and birds on the runway after landing and acted immediately.

53.title: 4 civilians shot dead in Ukraine's Luhansk region: Governor
53.article_body: Four civilians were reportedly shot dead during a Russian attack in Ukraine's eastern Luhansk region. The victims were trying to flee the Kreminna city by car when the incident occurred, said regional Governor Serhiy Gaidai in a Telegram post, according to a report. Meanwhile, multiple blasts were reported in Ukraine's Kyiv, Lviv and Dnipro regions.

54.title: Body of unidentified man found at Vasai beach in Palghar
54.article_body: The body of an unidentified man was found in a highly decomposed state at Vasai's Bhuigaon beach in Maharashtra's Palghar district. The body was spotted by fishermen and local people on Sunday evening, police said, adding that prima facie, the body was swept ashore by sea waves. A case of accidental death has been registered and an investigation is underway.

55.title: Noida is UP's crown just as Kashmir is India's crown: UP minister
55.article_body: UP Cabinet Minister Nand Gopal Gupta on Sunday said, "The way Kashmir...is a crown for India similarly, Noida is Uttar Pradesh's crown." Gupta made the comment during a visit to Noida on the occasion of the city's 47th foundation day. He inaugurated and laid foundation stones to projects worth ₹107 crore during the visit.

56.title: 20 injured after bus overturns in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar
56.article_body: A bus returning from a marriage party overturned on the Khuria Rahatgarh road in Madhya Pradesh's Sagar district on Monday. According to the police, at least 20 passengers got injured after the bus skidded off the road. The bus, which was returning to Kesli, overturned after its driver, who later fled the spot, dozed off while driving, police said.

57.title: Stones pelted at ladies coach in Bandra, railway police file case
57.article_body: The railway police have suo motu registered a case following a tip-off about an alleged stone-pelting incident. According to police, a female commuter informed on a helpline that an unknown person pelted stones on a ladies' coach of a local train when it halted at Bandra station's platform seven. The train had, however, left when police reached the platform.

58.title: Ukrainian pilots launch 'buy me a jet' website to crowdfund war planes
58.article_body: Ukrainian pilots have launched a website 'buymeafighterjet.com' seeking crowdfunding to purchase new fighter jets amid the country's war with Russia. A video uploaded on the website showed destroyed Ukrainian military equipment and infrastructure while a pilot looks into the camera and said, "Buy me a fighter jet". As per the website, the average cost of a jet is $25 million.

59.title: SRK & Shehnaaz hug each other at Baba Siddique's Iftar party, video surfaces
59.article_body: Indian politician Baba Siddique hosted an annual Iftaar party at Hotel Taj Lands End in Mumbai's Bandra which was attended by several celebrities. Recently a video has surfaced online where Shehnaaz was all smiles as she hugged actor Shah Rukh Khan. For the party, Shehnaaz opted to wear a light grey Patiala suit along with matching jhumkas.

60.title: Tusshar congratulates Ranbir-Alia, says 'It was private wedding which I respect'
60.article_body: Tusshar Kapoor on Monday congratulated the newlywed Bollywood couple Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt. "Very nice pictures, very natural. It was a private wedding which [I] respect," he said while talking to the media. "My best wishes from the family because Chintu Ji (Rishi Kapoor) was my father's (Jeetendra) close friend. So hearty wishes to them from...entire family," Tusshar added.

61.title: My 94*(51) vs CSK reminds me of my 2013 century for KXIP: Miller
61.article_body: After playing a match-winning knock of 94 runs against CSK, the Gujarat Titans batter David Miller said that this knock reminded him of his century which he scored for the Kings XI Punjab in 2013. "It does take me back to memory lane (referring to the 2013 knock)...with the rate quite high, I wanted to express myself (yesterday)," Miller said.

62.title: It was a minor incident: Police on fresh stone-pelting in Jahangirpuri
62.article_body: The fresh stone-pelting in Delhi's Jahangirpuri, where a communal violence broke out on Saturday, was a minor and one-off incident, police said on Monday. "Legal action is being taken. One person has been detained," it added. Police had earlier said that family members of an accused pelted two stones at a team when they went to question them.

63.title: Cyrus Sahukar's wife Vaishali Malahara shares wedding pics
63.article_body: Actor Cyrus Sahukar's wife Vaishali Malahara on Monday shared pictures from their wedding day on Instagram. She wrote, "With These 7 steps May you become my friend and May I deserve your friendship. May my friendship make me one with you and May your friendship make you one with me." The couple got married on April 15 in Alibaug.

64.title: People have wrong impression of Harsh Varrdhan that he's introvert: Anil on son
64.article_body: Speaking about his son, actor-producer Harsh Varrdhan, Anil Kapoor said people have this wrong impression of him that he's introverted and serious. "I was happy that media, critics and everybody praised his work and loved what he did [in AKvsAK]," he added. Speaking about his second collaboration with Harsh Varrdhan, Anil hilariously revealed Harsh Varrdhan rejected some of his suggestions.

65.title: Invited Macron to see evidence of ‘genocide’ in Ukraine: Zelenskyy
65.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that he has invited his French counterpart Emmanuel Macron to visit Ukraine and see the evidence of 'genocide'. "I want him (Macron) to understand that this is not war, but...[a] genocide," Zelenskyy added. His comments come days after Macron refused to call the ongoing Russian military offensive in Ukraine a 'genocide' in an interview.

66.title: Watching Umran bowl at 150 clicks an hour is super exciting: Steyn
66.article_body: SunRisers Hyderabad pace bowling coach Dale Steyn has said that watching the 22-year-old pacer Umran Malik "bowl at 150 clicks an hour consistently is super exciting". "Very often we try and create guys to make them more aware like changing your pace...But I think Umran is out and out raw. It's great to just let him loose," Steyn said.

67.title: 2 youths die after drowning in waterfall on Nagaon-Karbi Anglong border
67.article_body: Two youths lost their lives after  they drowned in a waterfall on Assam's Nagaon-Karbi Anglong district border. Police said that the deceased have been identified as Sajadul Islam and Raj Bora. Reports said that four people including the deceased had visited the waterfall and had gone missing. Police added that they reached the spot after getting information from the locals.

68.title: 3 masked men try to rob Ludhiana finance company’s office, manage to escape
68.article_body: Three masked men attempted to rob the office of a finance company in Ludhiana’s Raikot on Saturday. The manager of the firm said the robbers asked him to hand over almirah's keys to them. On resisting, the accused opened fire in the air. However, after the manager raised the alarm, the accused persons managed to escape.

69.title: Best hospitality in the world: Pietersen in Hindi before joining IPL commentary team
69.article_body: Former England captain Kevin Pietersen on Monday praised India in a tweet in Hindi ahead of joining the IPL commentary team and said, "Very excited to be back in India." He added, "Experiencing the best hospitality in the world is something I will never take lightly! See you in a few hours, India!"

70.title: They once had to eat samosas for breakfast: Rai on issues faced by India Women in 2017 WC
70.article_body: Talking about issues faced by India Women during 2017 World Cup, Vinod Rai revealed ahead of India's semi-final match against Australia, the players couldn't get the food they were supposed to. "They had to eat samosas for breakfast that morning!" Rai added that Harmanpreet Kaur, who scored 171* in that match, told him that she was cramping during her knock.

71.title: Bitcoin falls to lowest in a month, global crypto market's value falls to $1.9 trillion
71.article_body: The world's largest cryptocurrency Bitcoin fell as much as 4.2% to $38,580 and the second-largest cryptocurrency, Ether, dropped 4.7% to as low as $2,902 on Monday. The global crypto market’s value dropped about 4% in the past 24 hours to $1.9 trillion, according to the pricing from CoinGecko. Bitcoin has been struggling along with risk assets in recent months.

72.title: Keerthy congratulates Madhavan's son on bagging gold at Danish Open
72.article_body: Actress Keerthy Suresh took to Twitter to congratulate Madhavan's 16-year-old son Vedaant on winning a gold medal in swimming at the Danish Open 2022. "Kudos to the champion Vedaant Madhavan. Your achievement is an inspiration to all! Congratulations to the proud father," she wrote. Vedaant won the medal in the 800m swimming event.

73.title: Sri Lanka Cricket asked to confirm on hosting Asia Cup by July 27: Report
73.article_body: Sri Lanka Cricket (SLC) board has been reportedly asked by the Asian Cricket Council (ACC) to decide on hosting the Asia Cup tournament by July 27. The tournament is scheduled to be held in Sri Lanka but the ongoing economic and political crisis in the country might take away the hosting rights from the SLC, a source said.

74.title: Party will decide on plan to expand, rejig Cabinet: K'taka CM
74.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Monday said BJP President JP Nadda will hold a meeting regarding the state and thereafter decide on Karnataka Cabinet's expansion or reshuffle. This comes as BJP gears up for Karnataka Assembly polls which are scheduled to be held next year. There are currently 29 ministers in the state Cabinet against the sanctioned strength of 34.

75.title: Was never influenced by Salman Khan: 'Tere Naam' co-star Bhumika
75.article_body: Actress Bhumika Chawla, speaking about her 'Tere Naam' co-star Salman Khan, has said that she was never influenced by him "in any such manner". Bhumika added, "Salman has changed a lot, I see so much difference." "From what I hear...[Salman has] seen a kind of good growth in him as a person and even as an artist," she further stated.

76.title: I smeared henna all over my face at Alia-Ranbir's mehendi: Karan
76.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar has revealed that he mistakenly smeared henna all over his face at Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor's mehendi ceremony. He said that he had decided to get mehendi on his hands but wasn't used to it and tried wiping sweat from his face but smeared it with henna. "Alia's makeup artist...applied lotion on my face." Karan added.

77.title: Won’t accept N Korea’s escalating tests as normal: US envoy
77.article_body: A US official has called for a joint deterrent along with South Korea against North Korea's escalating weapons tests. "It is extremely important for the United Nations Security Council to send a clear signal to the DPRK (Democratic People's Republic of Korea) that we will not accept its escalatory tests as normal," said Sung Kim, US envoy on North Korea.

78.title: Mariupol doesn't exist anymore: Ukraine's Foreign Minister after Russian siege
78.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba has said the port city of Mariupol "doesn't exist anymore". "The situation in Mariupol is both dire militarily and heartbreaking. The city doesn't exist anymore," Kuleba told CBS News. "It seems from the way the Russian army behaves in Mariupol, they decided to raze the city to the ground at any cost,"  he added.

79.title: Curfew in 2 Amravati cities after stone-pelting incidents; 23 arrested
79.article_body: Curfew was imposed in Achalpur and Paratwada in Maharashtra's Amravati Rural after two groups pelted stones at each other allegedly over removal of religious flags on Sunday. Police have arrested 23 people for rioting. Three companies of the State Reserve Police Force (SRPF), 300 police personnel from Amravati Police and other security personnel have been deployed to keep vigil.

80.title: Can't ignore work: Bharti to trolls who criticised her for working post-pregnancy
80.article_body: Comedian-host Bharti Singh reacted to trolls who criticised her for working post-pregnancy. She reportedly said that she's not an angel who can rest forever. She added there are a lot of working women who leave their one-week-old kids at home to resume work. Bharti further said there are work commitments that one cannot ignore, hence work has to be resumed.

81.title: Have written a very strong story: Director Koratala Siva on 'NTR30'
81.article_body: Filmmaker Koratala Siva, speaking about his upcoming film with Jr NTR, has said, "Pre-production work currently going on...we're aiming to commence the shoot in June." "Have written a very strong story...which can reach a large set of audience" he added. The film is tentatively named 'NTR30'. Reportedly, Alia Bhatt was offered the female lead, however, she declined.

82.title: Captaincy comes naturally to Iyer, his mindset is clear: Ravi Shastri
82.article_body: Former India cricketer Ravi Shastri has said that "captaincy comes naturally" to KKR skipper Shreyas Iyer. "You don't feel like he's (Iyer) leading KKR for the first time. Looks like he's been captaining them for the last three-to-four seasons," Shastri said. "Iyer's mindset is clear about what brand of cricket he needs to play as a batter," he added.

83.title: Maoists kill 30-yr-old man who had come to meet relatives in Chhattisgarh
83.article_body: A 30-year-old man was allegedly killed by Maoists at Kolaiguda in Chhattisgarh's Sukma district in the early hours of Monday. The deceased has been identified as Dudhi Ganga. Ganga was a resident of Telangana and had run away from his village in Chhattisgarh years ago. He had come back to meet relatives at some function, police said.

84.title: Action to be taken without bias: Delhi Police Commissioner on Jahangirpuri violence
84.article_body: Delhi Police Commissioner Rakesh Asthana on Monday said that action will be taken without bias against all those found to be involved in the communal clashes in Jahangirpuri. "We will take action against whomever evidence of involvement is found during the investigation, irrespective of religion, creed, caste and community," Asthana said.

85.title: FIR not an encyclopedia of events: SC on HC granting bail to Ashish Mishra
85.article_body: The Supreme Court has cancelled the bail granted to Union Minister Ajay Mishra Teni's son Ashish Mishra in the Lakhimpur case. Referring to Allahabad High Court's earlier order which granted bail to Ashish, it said, "FIR cannot be treated as an encyclopedia of events. Judicial precedents were ignored." It also said victims were denied the chance of an effective hearing.

86.title: Malaika returns to work after car accident, says 'feels good to be back'
86.article_body: Malaika Arora, who met with an accident on Mumbai-Pune highway earlier this month, shared on Monday that she has returned to work. Malaika, taking to Instagram Stories, shared a picture from a set, writing, "Feels good to be back on set." Malaika got into a car accident on April 2, following which she was taken to Apollo Hospital for treatment.

87.title: Kim Kardashian walks off Ellen's show following prank with spider
87.article_body: American television personality Kim Kardashian walked off comedienne Ellen DeGeneres' show after the latter pranked her with a fake spider. Ellen pretended to throw a spider out of its container while Kim ran away saying, "You're not doing this to me, I'm never going to get over it." Kim then walked out of the set waving and saying, "Bye, everyone!"

88.title: Citigroup initiates 'buy' rating on Paytm, raises target price by 32%
88.article_body: Citigroup Research has initiated 'buy' rating on Paytm owner One97 Communications and raised its target price to ₹910/share, up 32% from its current levels. Paytm's stock price has dropped nearly 70% from its IPO price of ₹2,150 led by regulatory headwinds and concerns about profitability. "Paytm has several potential levers to drive scale and improve profitability substantially," Citigroup said.

89.title: Only when Deepika entered my life, she made me appreciate living it: Ranveer
89.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh said that he had zero work-life balance but things changed for the better. He added, "I had zero work-life balance for the longest time. It was only when Deepika (Padukone) came into my life that she made me appreciate living it." "She sits down with me and goes through my calendar to ensure the same," he said.

90.title: Tried to kill myself: Poonam after Munawar says mom died of suicide
90.article_body: Actress Poonam Pandey, who is a contestant on reality show 'Lock Upp', has revealed that she tried to kill herself many times. Poonam further said she saw herself in Munawar's mother as he had revealed that she suffered domestic abuse for years and that she wasn't happy. Munawar had revealed that his mother died of suicide.

91.title: No one realised how big IPL was going to become: Brendon McCullum
91.article_body: Recalling the first-ever IPL match in 2008, Brendon McCullum said no one realised how big the tournament was going to become. McCullum played for KKR in the first-ever match and scored an unbeaten 158 runs. Talking about his knock, he said, "It took me eight balls to start." McCullum remains the only KKR batter to score a century in IPL.

92.title: Microsoft joins e-commerce platform Udaan's $225 million debt round
92.article_body: E-commerce platform Udaan on Monday said Microsoft Corporation has joined its $225 million fundraising through sale of convertible debt. In an email to employees, Udaan CFO Aditya Pande said the firm's plan of mandatorily convertible notes to IPO highlights Udaan's capital strategy's evolution. The notes will be converted into equity when Udaan raises funds next or during its planned IPO.

93.title: Sri Lankan Prez appoints 17 ministers amid anti-govt protests
93.article_body: Sri Lanka's President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Monday appointed 17 Cabinet ministers amid the anti-government protests owing to the economic crisis in the country. The new Cabinet reportedly has eight former ministers and several fresh entrants. This is the third Cabinet reshuffle in recent weeks. Earlier this month, as many as 26 ministers had resigned from the Cabinet.

94.title: Over 100 Islamist insurgents killed recently: Joint African forces
94.article_body: A joint military force of African countries, consisting of Nigeria, Niger and Cameroon, said on Sunday that they have killed over 100 Islamist insurgents in recent weeks. The killed insurgents included 10 commanders, it added. A joint task force spokesperson said that troops had entered deep into insurgent-controlled enclaves in Lake Chad area and recovered weapons, food and illicit drugs.

95.title: Wish you all the success, happiness: Suryakumar on Rahul's 30th birthday
95.article_body: Team India batter Suryakumar Yadav took to Twitter to wish teammate KL Rahul on his 30th birthday on Monday. "Happy Birthday to one of the kindest...wish you all the success and happiness brother. Looking forward to many more partnerships with you," he wrote. Cheteshwar Pujara tweeted, "[Rahul] have a year as swashbuckling as your game."

96.title: KTR to inaugurate Hyd's Bahadurpura flyover on Apr 19
96.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao will inaugurate the Bahadurpura flyover in Hyderabad on April 19. The six-lane flyover from Bahadurpura Police Station to Nehru Zoological Park is expected to ease traffic congestion in the area. The flyover, which is a part of the Telangana government's Strategic Road Development Programme (SRDP), has been built at an estimated cost of ₹69 crore.

97.title: No attempt made to hoist saffron flag at mosque in Jahangirpuri: Police
97.article_body: Delhi Police Commissioner Rakesh Asthana on Monday said no attempt was made to hoist saffron flag at a mosque during the Hanuman Jayanti procession in Jahangirpuri on Saturday. "Some people are trying to disturb peace through the medium of social media," he said. The police chief added, "Legal action will be taken against those who are found spreading misinformation."

98.title: Hopefully, I start & finish here: Narine ahead of 150th match for KKR
98.article_body: Sunil Narine, who will play his 150th match for KKR against Rajasthan Royals today, has said, "I've always told Venky [Mysore, CEO]...hopefully, I don't play for any other franchise." "I've loved my stay at KKR, so hopefully I start and finish here," he added. Narine, who was bought by KKR in 2012, has taken 147 wickets in 140 IPL matches.

99.title: Spread teachings of gods in right way, don’t be 'andh bhakts': Maha CM
99.article_body: Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray said people should spread the teachings of their gods in the right way rather than becoming "andh bhakts". "The true follower will understand the teaching of his God and spread it to all. The blind follower will only praise superficially and then sometimes change his affection," Thackeray added.

100.title: Gurugram civic body to start repairing Sector 28 roads next month
100.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG) plans to launch the repair of roads in Sector 28 next month, officials said on Sunday. The MCG has floated a tender worth ₹90 lakh for the work. Notably, a resident claimed that they have pursued the matter since 2013 and even pooled some money to repair a few stretches of the road.

101.title: Khurshid meets men who torched his home, says 'we decided to be friends'
101.article_body: Ex-Union Minister and Congress leader Salman Khurshid on Sunday shared a picture with the men who had set the entrance of his house on fire last year. "We talked and decided to be friends in peace. They felt bad about the event but went away pleased," said Khurshid. In November, Khurshid's Nainital house was vandalised amid controversy over his book.

102.title: Karisma Kapoor to star in Abhinay Deo's crime drama 'Brown'
102.article_body: Karisma Kapoor is set to play the lead role in a crime drama titled 'Brown'. The project, which is based on book 'City of Death' by Abheek Barua, will be directed by Abhinay Deo, who has previously helmed films like 'Delhi Belly' and 'Force 2'. Karisma took to Instagram to share some pictures from set and wrote, "To new beginnings."

103.title: Moving in small Mumbai flat was challenge, mother couldn't 'breathe': Poonam
103.article_body: Actress Poonam Dhillon said that moving into a small flat in Mumbai was a challenge after living in Chandigarh. "Initially, my mother said she couldn't 'breathe' in Mumbai...In Chandigarh...I biked to school, to the swimming club and elsewhere. I hadn't seen local trains or buses. The infrastructure of the city and the population was a kind of shock," she added.

104.title: South Korean band BTS' new album to release on June 10
104.article_body: South Korean boy band BTS' new album will release on June 10, the band's agency Big Hit Music said in a statement. "Details on the new album will be provided in a separate notice at a later date," the statement further read. In a teaser video posted on social media, BTS announced the album with the tagline 'We Are Bulletproof'.

105.title: Navi Mumbai corporator holds 'chai pe charcha' with citizens
105.article_body: Navi Mumbai corporator Vikrant Patil held 'chai pe charcha' to discuss issues faced by local residents. He held discussions on various issues such as roads, nallas, parks, municipal works, jobs and admissions in schools and colleges. A large number of citizens attended the event held at Patil's office.

106.title: Man dies by suicide after killing his family in UP's Ghazipur
106.article_body: A 35-year-old man allegedly died by suicide after killing his wife and two children in the Sadat Bazaar area of Ghazipur in Uttar Pradesh. According to the local police sub-inspector Mahendra Yadav, the accused, identified as Shivdas Sonekar, killed his wife Reena (30) and two children, aged five and three years, by smothering them with a pillow.

107.title: Amway India's assets worth ₹758 crore attached by ED over pyramid fraud
107.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate (ED) has attached assets worth ₹757.77 crore belonging to Amway India Enterprises Private Limited. According to ED, the firm was running a pyramid fraud in the guise of direct selling multi-level marketing networks. The attached properties include Amway's land and factory building in Tamil Nadu's Dindigul district, plant and machinery, vehicles, bank accounts and FDs.

108.title: Javed Miandad was the first batsman to win an ODI with last-ball six
108.article_body: Former Pakistani captain Javed Miandad was the first-ever batsman to help his team win an ODI by hitting a six off the match's last ball. Miandad achieved the feat against India on April 18, 1986 by hitting a maximum on the bowling of then 20-year-old fast bowler Chetan Sharma. Pakistan won that match by one wicket.

109.title: Told Nike this was not on: Rai on women cricketers' jerseys being made from men's kits
109.article_body: Ex-CoA Chairman Vinod Rai, in a recent interview, said that women cricketers had not been taken seriously in India till around 2006. He added, "I was aghast to know...men's uniforms were being cut up and re-stitched for women's players. I had to ring up Nike and tell them that this wasn't on and that their design would be different."

110.title: Sensex crashes 1,170 points to end at 57,166 dragged by IT stocks
110.article_body: The Sensex plunged 1,172 points on Monday to close at 57,166, while the Nifty fell 302 points to end below 17,200, at 17,173. Most sectoral indices were trading lower today with the IT index declining nearly 5%, and realty and bank indices down 1% each. Infosys, HDFC Bank, Tech Mahindra and Apollo Hospitals were among the top Nifty losers.

111.title: Hyderabad's 216-year-old heritage monument to be reopened for public in May
111.article_body: The 216-year-old British Residency in Hyderabad will be reopened for the public in May, state Archaeology Minister V Srinivas Goud announced. According to the local heritage activists, since 2013, the monument was undergoing restoration work which was taken up by the World Monuments Fund. Notably, the residency served as a seat of power for the British in Hyderabad before independence.

112.title: Will target Israel's heart if it acts against Iran: Prez Raisi
112.article_body: Iran's President Ebrahim Raisi has warned Israel of a military response if it acts against the Islamic nation. "If you [Israel] take the slightest move against our nation, our armed forces will target the heart of the Zionist regime," said Raisi. This comes after Israel said it will not accept Iran as "a nuclear threshold state".

113.title: I don't own a home, I stay at friends' places: World's richest man Elon Musk
113.article_body: Elon Musk, the world's richest person with a net worth of over $250 billion, said, "I don't even own a home right now...I'm literally staying at friends' places." He added, "If I travel to the Bay Area, which is where most of Tesla engineering is, I basically rotate through friends' spare bedrooms." Musk also said, "I don't have a yacht."

114.title: Miller played shots from the top of the cover vs CSK, he'll be dangerous: Sachin
114.article_body: Talking about GT batter David Miller's unbeaten 94-run innings against CSK, Sachin Tendulkar said if the South Africa batter's "good phase" continues, then he'll be a very dangerous batter in the ongoing IPL season. "Because he played most of his game towards mid-wicket. He played shots from the top of the cover, which means he's absolutely in control," explained Tendulkar.

115.title: Bhuvneshwar Kumar becomes first Indian fast bowler to take 150 wickets in IPL
115.article_body: SRH fast bowler Bhuvneshwar Kumar has become the first Indian fast bowler to take 150 wickets in IPL. The 32-year-old achieved the feat after registering figures of 4-0-22-3 against PBKS on Sunday. Jasprit Bumrah is the second highest wicket-taker in IPL among Indian fast bowler with 134 scalps. Bhuvneshwar and Bumrah are followed by Umesh Yadav with 129 wickets.

116.title: Only hundred by a KKR player was hit in the 1st-ever IPL match
116.article_body: Brendon McCullum smashed the only hundred by a KKR player in the first-ever IPL match against RCB at Chinnaswamy Stadium, Bengaluru on April 18, 2008. He slammed 158* off 73 balls, including 13 sixes and 10 fours. It remained the highest IPL score till Chris Gayle slammed 175*(66) against PWI in 2013.

117.title: I'm married: Prince after Azma comments on his past equation with Nora Fatehi
117.article_body: In a new promo, 'Lock Upp' contestant Azma Fallah was seen making a comment about Prince Narula's equation with Nora Fatehi from the time they appeared together on 'Bigg Boss 9'. She said, "Prince Narula didn't get...attention from Nora Fatehi." Reacting to Azma's comment, Prince said, "It'll be...bad if you get personal again. I'm a married man. Shut up."

118.title: Every IPL season, Samson starts with a bang & then just tapers off: Aakash
118.article_body: Aakash Chopra has opined that Rajasthan Royals skipper Sanju Samson needs to play a captain's knock in the ongoing IPL 2022. "Every season, Samson starts with a bang and then just tapers off," Aakash stated. "Time has come for him to lift himself and the team as well," he added. Samson has scored 117 runs in five matches so far.

119.title: Ex-BJP ward member shot dead in Odisha; accused's family attacked
119.article_body: A 56-year-old former BJP ward member was shot dead following a dispute over a pond in Odisha's Dhenkanal on Sunday. In response, the victim's family, along with their supporters, attacked the accused's family and torched their house, causing serious injuries to accused's wife and three-year-old son, police said. Dhenkanal BJP leader Ramchandra Patra claimed it to be a political killing.

120.title: PBKS skipper Mayank is better, he should be ready to be back: Dhawan
120.article_body: Punjab Kings batter Shikhar Dhawan, speaking about skipper Mayank Agarwal's injury, has said, "Mayank is better and he should be ready to be back." Mayank did not feature in the match against SunRisers Hyderabad due to a toe injury and Dhawan was named the stand-in captain. SRH defeated Punjab in the match by seven wickets.

121.title: Dhoni's mindset was to look at team, never dwelled on his own performance: Gary Kirsten
121.article_body: Ex-India coach Gary Kirsten has called ex-India captain MS Dhoni the "ultimate team player". Kirsten added, "As a captain, Dhoni's mindset was always to look at the team first and see the way the team could be thriving. He never dwelled on his own performances." It was during Gary's stint with Dhoni that India won the 2011 World Cup.

122.title: Hyd Police seize ganja worth ₹1 crore, arrest 2 suspected peddlers
122.article_body: Hyderabad’s Rachakonda Police on Friday arrested two suspected interstate drug traffickers and seized 700 kg ganja worth ₹1 crore from their possession. Police intercepted the lorry carrying the contraband, which was en route to Rajasthan from Andhra Pradesh, near Hyderabad. The drugs were concealed inside the lorry, which was loaded with plywood and home decor sheets, reports stated.

123.title: Was signed as lead in 'Kumkum Bhagya', was very adamant to play it: Mrunal
123.article_body: Actress Mrunal Thakur said she was signed to play the lead role in the television serial 'Kumkum Bhagya' but it eventually turned into the second lead space. "I realised it didn't matter because I still won immense popularity...What matters is what impact you leave on audience...whosoever is the lead character...at times, other characters are ones with more drama," she added.

124.title: UP makes face masks compulsory in Lucknow, NCR amid COVID-19 surge
124.article_body: In view of the increase in COVID-19 cases in India, the Uttar Pradesh government on Monday made it mandatory for people to wear a face mask in public places in the capital city of Lucknow and six NCR districts. People in Gautam Buddha Nagar, Ghaziabad, Hapur, Meerut, Bulandshahr and Baghpat will also have to compulsorily wear face masks.

125.title: Shakti Kapoor shares pic with Ranjeet and Asrani among others
125.article_body: Veteran actor Shakti Kapoor on Monday took to Instagram to share a picture with veteran actors Ranjeet, Dilip Joshi, Rakesh Bedi, Puneet Issar and Asrani. He captioned the picture, "Last eve was nice meeting old friends." A social media user commented on Shakti's post, "Peripona to all our legends," while another one wrote, "Fantastic frame of friendship."

126.title: Enjoyed my debut game for Sussex: Pujara on 201* in county cricket
126.article_body: India batter Cheteshwar Pujara, who scored a double ton in County Championship Division Two, said he enjoyed his debut game for Sussex and was glad to contribute to the team's cause. In response to Derbyshire's 505 first-innings total, Sussex got bundled out for 174 before Pujara (201*) and Tom Haines (243) scored double tons to draw the match.

127.title: Good governance begins in the founders' heads: Info Edge Founder
127.article_body: Info Edge Founder Sanjeev Bikhchandani tweeted, "Good governance begins in the founders' heads. No amount of oversight...can ensure a company is well governed if the founders are not committed." He added, "If you are better governed, you will sleep more peacefully at night." Bikhchandani's comments come after Sequoia Capital India published a blog on the need for better corporate governance.

128.title: Tribal woman out to collect vegetables in forest attacked by bear in Tripura
128.article_body: A 45-year-old tribal woman was attacked by a wild bear in Tripura when she went into a forest area to collect tubers and vegetables. Reports said local youth spotted the woman and shifted her to a local hospital. One of her neighbours said that she was bleeding profusely. She suffered cuts on her face and other parts of her body.

129.title: Torture chambers built by Russian troops in southern Ukraine: Zelenskyy
129.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday said Russian troops in southern Ukraine have been carrying out torture and kidnappings. "Torture chambers are built there. They abduct representatives of local governments and anyone deemed visible to local communities," he said in an address to the nation. Zelenskyy said that humanitarian aid has been stolen, creating famine.

130.title: Swiggy, Zomato back startup UrbanPiper in $24 mn funding round
130.article_body: Restaurant management platform UrbanPiper has raised $24 million in a funding round led by existing investors Sequoia Capital India and Tiger Global, along with new investors Swiggy and Zomato. The Bengaluru-based startup is a B2B software platform with over 27,000 hotels and restaurants live on its platform. UrbanPiper claims to process 18% of all online food orders in India.

131.title: Can't wait for the exceptional ride: Johar on trailer of Ajay's 'Runway 34'
131.article_body: Karan Johar has praised the trailer of Ajay Devgn's upcoming film 'Runway 34', writing on Twitter, "Breathtaking and thrilling." "Cannot wait for the exceptional ride...An intriguing edge of the seat story and the perfect summer film," he added. Ajay thanked Karan and wrote, "That's a really cool compliment...I would like for you to see the film, when...first copy is out."

132.title: 50 Russian artists' paintings stuck in S Korea due to sanctions
132.article_body: Paintings by around 50 Russian artists which were loaned to Sejong Museum of Art in South Korea's Seoul are stuck there due to sanctions imposed by multiple countries amid Russia-Ukraine conflict, organisers said on Monday. The situation has been caused as all flights to Moscow have been shut due to sanctions, AFP reported. The paintings were loaned for an exhibition.

133.title: L&T Infotech, Mindtree may merge into a $22 billion firm: Report
133.article_body: Larsen & Toubro is considering a merger between its publicly traded software firms, Larsen & Toubro Infotech and Mindtree, to create a $22 billion firm, Bloomberg reported. The boards of the two companies could consider share swap ratios for the merger as early as next week. L&T acquired Mindtree in 2019 and holds about a 61% stake in the company.

134.title: Fresh stone-pelting in Jahangirpuri, police attacked by relatives of accused
134.article_body: Stones were pelted at a police team on Monday near the site of Saturday's communal violence in Delhi's Jahangirpuri. As per police, family members of an accused pelted two stones at the team when they went to question them and one person has been detained. As many as 23 people have so far been arrested in connection to Saturday's incident.

135.title: Anywhere with you: Athiya Shetty wishes boyfriend KL Rahul on b'day
135.article_body: Actress Athiya Shetty wished her boyfriend, cricketer KL Rahul on his 30th birthday. Taking to Instagram, Athiya posted several monochrome photos of them. In the first picture, Athiya is seen holding KL Rahul as they posed for the camera. Alongside the post, she wrote, "Anywhere with you, happy birthday." Reacting to the post, KL Rahul commented, "Love you."

136.title: Byculla Zoo sees 50,000 visitors over long weekend, collects ₹24 lakh
136.article_body: Nearly 50,000 people visited the Byculla Zoo in Mumbai over the long weekend and it earned a revenue of over ₹24 lakh, officials said. Around 20,478 people came to the zoo on Sunday alone. The zoo, which is open from 9.30 am to 5 pm on all days, charges an entry fee of ₹50 per person.

137.title: ₹48,000 cr wiped off Infosys' m-cap in a day as shares plunge the most in 2 years
137.article_body: The shares of Infosys plunged over 9% on Monday during the intra-day trade, wiping out ₹48,000 crore from the company's market capital. At 9%, Infosys stock had the biggest fall in the market since March 23, 2020. This comes after several analysts cut Infosys margin estimates over its weaker-than-expected earnings for the March quarter.

138.title: Manish Sisodia shares Guj govt schools' pics 'without desks', 'broken toilets'
138.article_body: Ahead of PM Narendra Modi’s visit to Gujarat, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia tweeted pictures of government schools in Gujarat "without desks" and "broken toilets". "Dear PM, you may not see the pictures of these schools from the modern centre of Vidya Samiksha Kendra, where there is no desk to sit, there are spider webs...Toilets are broken," Sisodia tweeted.

139.title: 16 wagons of goods train derail in Punjab's Rupnagar
139.article_body: A train with 16 wagons, that was coming from Ropar Thermal Plant, derailed in Punjab's Rupnagar. The incident took place after driver applied brakes suddenly after a herd of cattle came on the railway tracks. DRM Ambala said that few express and passenger trains have been cancelled after the incident.

140.title: We didn't capitalise on what was a very good base while batting: Fleming
140.article_body: CSK head coach Stephen Fleming said they couldn't capitalise in the last five overs while batting against GT on Sunday. Fleming added, "Two contributing factors [towards our defeat] were outstanding innings from David Miller and a very good cameo from Rashid Khan." He further said, "It's a hard one...we were in control...so, losing from there is very hard."

141.title: Both murders were planned: Kerala ADGP on SDPI & RSS workers' killings
141.article_body: After an SDPI worker and an RSS worker were killed in Kerala's Palakkad, ADGP Law and Order, Vijay Sakhare, on Monday said that undoubtedly, both the murders were "planned". "There was a conspiracy behind both the murders. We have a fair idea about who are the accused persons," Sakhare added. "The suspects will be caught soon," Sakhare stated.

142.title: WPI inflation rises to record 14.55% in Mar, Govt cites Russia-Ukraine war as reason
142.article_body: India's Wholesale Price-based Inflation (WPI) has surged to a record high of 14.55% in March. The Centre has said that the high rate of inflation in March is due to "the rise in prices of crude petroleum and natural gas, mineral oils, basic metals" caused by the Russia-Ukraine conflict. Notably, In March 2021, the WPI was 7.89%.

143.title: Umran's pace means I'm a target, batters think I'm slower: Bhuvneshwar
143.article_body: On being asked how his SRH teammate Umran Malik's pace has helped him in the ongoing IPL, veteran pacer Bhuvneshwar Kumar jokingly said, "More than helping me...I'm a target as batters think I'm slower." Bhuvneshwar also praised Umran, stating that watching the 22-year-old in action is "joy". "Hope the [batters] going after me leads to wickets...not boundaries," he added.

144.title: VHP’s Surendra Jain seeks NIA probe into Jahangirpuri violence
144.article_body: VHP’s Surendra Jain has demanded a probe by the NIA into the Jahangirpuri violence that took place in Delhi on Hanuman Jayanti. "Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal has become the sleeper cell of terrorists today. My demand is from the Central government that an investigation should be done by the NIA because it involves the issue of national security," Jain added.

145.title: 2 killed as BJP MLA's Scorpio rams into motorcycle in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri
145.article_body: Two men were killed when their motorcycle and a Scorpio car collided head-on in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri, police said. Police added that the Scorpio car is said to belong to Lakhimpur Kheri Sadar MLA Yogesh Verma. Reports said that the SUV is registered in the name of MLA's wife Neelam Verma. Police took the Scorpio driver into its custody.

146.title: Rescued tiger jumps into water during release in Sundarbans, old video resurfaces
146.article_body: IFS Officer Parveen Kaswan on Sunday shared an old video that captured the release of a rescued tiger that jumped and swam away from a boat in Sundarbans. Sharing the video, he wrote, "That tiger sized jump though." A user commented on the video, "Reminds me of Life of Pi!" Another tweeted, "It's swimming like an expert fish."

147.title: Grammy-winning singer Jon Batiste to make acting debut with The Color Purple
147.article_body: Multiple Grammy-winning singer Jon Batiste is set to make his feature acting debut with 'The Color Purple'. Blitz Bazawule, the filmmaker behind Beyoncé's 'Black Is King', will direct the upcoming project. In addition to Batiste, 'The Color Purple' will also feature Taraji P. Henson, Fantasia Barrino, Danielle Brooks, Colman Domingo, Corey Hawkins and others.

148.title: Man who set self on fire at Punjab police station dies; 11 booked
148.article_body: Eleven people, including a municipal councillor, have been booked after a 35-year-old man who set himself on fire at a police station in Punjab's Kapurthala died at a hospital on Sunday, police said. The deceased had claimed that the officials aren't acting on his complaint about his wife not being allowed to leave prostitution. The incident had occurred last week.

149.title: Which cricketers have bowled 20th over of an innings as maiden in IPL history?
149.article_body: SRH pacer Umran Malik became the fourth bowler to record the 20th over of an innings as maiden in IPL after conceding no runs and taking three wickets in PBKS' 20th over. Irfan Pathan bowled the 20th over as maiden, while representing KXIP against MI in 2008. Other bowlers to do so are Lasith Malinga (2009) and Jaydev Unadkat (2017).

150.title: Sleeper cells trained by police: Kerala BJP Vice President on RSS worker’s killing
150.article_body: Kerala BJP Vice President KS Radhakrishnan claimed that there are "sleeper cells" in the police force receiving training from police and armed forces. His remark came after an RSS worker was killed in Palakkad. "Primary duty of the state is to protect the life and property of citizens. But a murder happened within the vicinity of the police," Radhakrishnan added.

151.title: Car returning from marriage party hits truck in Amethi; 6 dead, 4 injured
151.article_body: A Bolero car returning from a wedding ceremony collided with a truck in Amethi, Uttar Pradesh on Sunday. According to SP Dinesh Singh, the accident, which took place around midnight in the Gauriganj area, claimed the lives of six people, including an 8-year-old boy, and injured four. Notably, the Bolero was returning from Rae Bareli's Nasirabad area, police said.

152.title: Man clicks obscene pics of wife, circulates them in B'luru; booked
152.article_body: A man has been booked for allegedly taking obscene pictures of his wife and blackmailing her in Bengaluru, police said on Monday. The man had reportedly demanded that his wife give him money and when she refused, he circulated the pictures to his friends. The complainant claimed that the accused had also tortured her to sleep with his friend.

153.title: Was surprised Sonu Sood knew about me; it was a fan moment: Karan Kundrra
153.article_body: Karan Kundrra reacted after actor Sonu Sood praised him by calling him "a tough guy". In an interview, replying to a question on Neha and Karan, Sonu said, "Karan Kundrra is more bad***...I'd say he's a tough guy." Reacting to it, Karan tweeted, "I didn't even know...Sonu paaji (brother) knew who I was...this [was] like a fan moment for me."

154.title: What is the state-wise active COVID-19 case tally as daily cases jump nearly 90%?
154.article_body: India recorded 2,183 COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, an 89.8% jump from 1,150 cases reported a day before. In terms of active COVID-19 cases, Kerala has 2,466 cases, Delhi has 1,518, Karnataka has 1,506 and Assam has 1,349. While Haryana has 911 active cases, it is followed by Maharashtra with 646 cases and Uttar Pradesh with 610 cases.

155.title: Burglars enter Pune house via exhaust fan window, steal items worth Rs 86,000
155.article_body: Tanmay Kulkarni from Pune has lodged an FIR in a case where burglars entered his house, which is in front of a police station, through exhaust fan window and stole valuables worth ₹86,000, including some gold ornaments, a music system, laptop, and iPod. Police, in press release, said that Kulkarni had gone out with his wife when burglars entered house.

156.title: 27-year-old history-sheeter arrested in Mumbai; pistol, knives seized
156.article_body: A history-sheeter (27), accused in an October 2020 murder case, was arrested by the Mumbai Crime Branch's Unit-7 in Ghatkopar. The police seized a country-made pistol and two knives from the accused, who is identified as Amol Avate. He was allegedly involved in the murder of Ambadas Salve, a resident of Vikhroli (east), along with five other people, police said.

157.title: Hong Kong bans Air India flights till April 24 after 3 found COVID positive
157.article_body: Hong Kong has banned Air India services till April 24 after three passengers on one of its flights tested positive for COVID-19 post arrival on Saturday, an official said. "Due to restrictions imposed by Hong Kong authorities and limited demand on the sector, our flights to Hong Kong & back of 19th and 23rd April stand cancelled," Air India tweeted.

158.title: I don't remember seeing Dhoni losing too many games like this: Vaughan
158.article_body: Ex-England captain Michael Vaughan questioned Ravindra Jadeja's captaincy after CSK's fifth loss in six games in the ongoing IPL season and said that he doesn't remember ex-captain MS Dhoni losing too many games like this. "Honestly, it wasn't a tight game [against GT] and they lost it. They should've easily won that game by 10 or 15 runs," he added.

159.title: Pujara smashes double hundred on Sussex debut, ends 52-innings century drought
159.article_body: Indian batter Cheteshwar Pujara smashed 201*(387) against Derbyshire on his debut for Sussex in County Championship Division Two. With this, Pujara became only the second Indian to score a double century in the County Championship after Mohammed Azharuddin. Pujara smashed a first-class hundred after going 52 innings without a ton.

160.title: Intelligence system in Kerala has failed miserably: VD Satheesan
160.article_body: Kerala Leader of Opposition VD Satheesan has criticised the state's intelligence system in the wake of the last week's back-to-back political killings in Palakkad. "Attempts are being made in Kerala for communal polarization. The victims are ordinary people and the conspirators are laughing. The intelligence system in Kerala has failed miserably," the Congress leader said.

161.title: TN girl kills neighbour for jewellery, says 'parents didn't buy ornaments'
161.article_body: 17-year-old, class 12 girl student has been arrested for allegedly strangling her 76-year-old neighbour and stealing 21-sovereign gold from the woman's house in Tamil Nadu. The girl said she murdered the woman for jewellery because her parents are daily wagers and haven't bought gold ornaments to save for her wedding. Incident came to light when woman's daughter found her dead.

162.title: Shelling killed 18, injured 100 in Kharkiv in 4 days: Ukraine Prez
162.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Sunday said that Russia's shelling is "constant" in Kharkiv and 18 people were killed in the past four days due to it. He added that over 100 people were also injured due to the shelling in the same period. "This is nothing but deliberate terror: mortars, artillery against ordinary residential quarters," he further said.

163.title: 5 arrested for hoisting saffron flag on dargah in Gujarat
163.article_body: Five persons were arrested and a juvenile was detained for allegedly hoisting a saffron flag on a dargah during a Hanuman Jayanti procession in Gujarat's Veraval. According to police, when the procession was passing by Magrebisha Bapu's dargah, some men "entered the dargah premises and hoisted a 'bhagva' (saffron) flag on the roof of the toilet block".

164.title: Received ₹500 as my 1st pay for working as a hostess at a conference: Samantha
164.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu during a Q&A session on Instagram revealed that her first income was ₹500 which she had received as a hostess for an eight-hour shift at a conference in a hotel. She added that she was in Class 10 or 11 at that time. Born in Chennai, Samantha attended St Stephen's Matriculation School in Pallavaram.

165.title: Shiv Sena MLA Mangesh Kudalkar’s wife dies by suicide
165.article_body: Shiv Sena MLA Mangesh Kudalkar's wife died by suicide in Mumbai's Kurla on Sunday. The 42-year-old, Rajni Kudalkar, was reportedly found hanging in the kitchen of her house by a family member who called the police. The police said they are trying to find out the reason behind the incident and will record statements of the family members.

166.title: Manish Malhotra shares pic of Alia in her mehendi outfit that took 3,000 hours to make
166.article_body: Fashion designer Manish Malhotra shared a picture of Alia Bhatt wearing her mehendi outfit that took 3,000 hours to make. "Alia...chose to personalise [the] ensemble with...sustainable approach...where approximately 180 textiles patches come together to mark her momentous occasion," he wrote. "The custom touches reminisce about her journey and depict symbolic elements of her memories," he added.

167.title: TV actor Vivian to marry ex-journalist from Egypt, 5 years after his split with Vahbiz
167.article_body: TV actor Vivian Dsena has revealed that he is planning to tie the knot with Nouran Aly, a former journalist from Egypt. "We first interacted around four-and-a-half years ago, when she contacted me for an interview," Vivian said. Vivian was earlier married to TV actress Vahbiz Dorabjee. They split five years ago and finalised their divorce in December 2021.

168.title: Blue is the only jersey missing: Harbhajan on SRH pacer Umran Malik
168.article_body: Harbhajan Singh has termed SRH's 22-year-old pacer Umran Malik as the "most deserving one" among the uncapped players to be selected for India's squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup. "Blue is the only jersey missing and he should get it early...He could be your match-winner [in Australia]," stated Harbhajan. Umran has picked nine wickets in six games this season.

169.title: Attacks on processions designed way to divide country: JP Nadda
169.article_body: BJP National President JP Nadda on Sunday said that the Congress party is behaving in the most irresponsible manner. Addressing the party workers in Karnataka's Hosapete, Nadda said, "You must have seen the attacks on Ram Navami procession or something else at some other place...I can say it's a designed way to divide the country," Nadda added.

170.title: Rahul Gandhi lacks stability, can't be entrusted with responsibilities: PJ Kurien
170.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi is a leader who has “no stability” and cannot be entrusted with responsibilities, senior party leader PJ Kurien said. "The captain cannot leave the ship when it is in trouble. After the 2019 elections, he resigned abruptly from the post (of Congress chief). But, he continues to take important decisions in the party," Kurien added.

171.title: Met Salman as kid; he was eating from tandoor, mom made us stand with him: Neha
171.article_body: Singer Neha Bhasin said that she first met actor Salman Khan when she was a child. In an interview with Bollywood Hungama, she said that she has picture of the meeting and that Salman was standing near a tandoor and eating something from it. "My mom made us stand with him. Me and my sister were looking silly," she added.

172.title: Aamir dances to Dhol Jageero Da with influencer Ruhee Dosani, she shares video
172.article_body: Social media influencer Ruhee Dosani took to Instagram to share a video of herself dancing with Aamir Khan to the song 'Dhol Jageero Da'. Aamir had invited Ruhee and her family to his house. "Still don't know how to...process the fact that Aamir sir was so kind to agree to spend time with my family to celebrate Vaisakhi," Ruhee wrote.

173.title: 2 killed, 17 injured in separate shootings in US
173.article_body: Two people were killed and at least 17 injured in two separate incidents of mass shooting in US over the Easter weekend. A shooting at a nightclub in South Carolina left nine people injured, while another in Pittsburgh left two dead and eight wounded. These happened a day after 14 people were injured in a shooting incident in South Carolina.

174.title: After silver, Madhavan's son Vedaant wins gold at Danish Open; actor shares video
174.article_body: Actor R Madhavan's son Vedaant has bagged a gold medal in swimming at the Danish Open 2022. Vedaant won the medal in the 800 m swimming event and clocked 8:17:28. Sharing a video of the felicitation ceremony, Madhavan wrote, "GOLD….With all your blessings and God's greatest...winning streak continues." Earlier, he had won a silver medal in a different category.

175.title: 'Social Media Lab' activated in Maha, 3,000 posts inciting communal tensions deleted
175.article_body: Mumbai Police on Monday said that a 'Social Media Lab' has been activated to keep a vigil on posts that could incite communal tensions in Maharashtra. Mumbai Police added that around 3,000 such posts have been deleted till now.
