"Hybrid work is associated with improved worker outcomes," it added.

354.title: CM Kejriwal is an irresponsible leader: Delhi Congress chief
354.article_body: Delhi Congress President Anil Chaudhary has called CM Arvind Kejriwal an "irresponsible leader" after violence took place in Delhi's Jahangirpuri area on Saturday. "Kejriwal is just playing the blame game. This is a statement from an irresponsible leader. When Congress was in power, Shiela (Dixit) ji stood for the people and maintained peace and harmony," Chaudhary said.

355.title: FPIs turn net sellers again, withdraw ₹4,500 cr between Apr 8-15
355.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) turned net sellers again after withdrawing ₹4,500 crore between April 8-15. FPIs had been net sellers for six months between October 2021 and March 2022 and had turned net buyers between April 1-8 with an investment of ₹7,707 crore. Apart from equities, FPIs withdrew net ₹415 crore from the debt markets last week.

356.title: Muralitharan picked up 800th Test wicket on his career's last ball
356.article_body: Ex-Sri Lankan off-spinner Muttiah Muralitharan, the only player in Test cricket history to take 800 wickets, picked up his 800th wicket on the final ball of his Test career. Muralitharan, who turns 50 today, dismissed India's Pragyan Ojha as his 800th Test wicket in July 2010. Muralitharan is the fastest to pick 400, 500, 600, 700 and 800 Test wickets.

357.title: 5 killed, 5 injured as vehicle overturns in Assam; PM expresses condolences
357.article_body: At least five persons, who were returning home from a Bihu function, were killed and five others sustained injuries when a vehicle carrying them overturned in Assam's Biswanath. "Prima facie, over-speeding seems to be the cause of the accident," a police officer said. Prime Minister Narendra Modi and CM Himanta Biswa Sarma expressed their condolences over the loss of lives.

358.title: Fan blocks Shilpa's car door taking selfie, she says 'What are you doing?'
358.article_body: A video shared by a journalist account is going viral on social media showing a fan blocking actress Shilpa Shetty's car door while trying to take a selfie. Shilpa was getting into her car with her daughter Samisha in Mumbai's Juhu when the incident occurred. She can be heard saying, "Arrey bhai, kya kar rahe ho (What are you doing)?"

359.title: Ranveer stands on table, raps 'Apna Time Aayega' at Delhi wedding
359.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh attended a wedding in Delhi and stood on a table while rapping his song 'Apna Time Aayega' from 2019 film 'Gully Boy'. In another video, Ranveer wore a red coat while rapping as wedding guests danced around him. The pictures and videos were shared on Instagram Stories by fashion designer and influencer Tarini Manchanda.

360.title: Connivance between SDPI and CPI(M): Kerala BJP Vice President
360.article_body: The Vice President of BJP's Kerala unit, KS Radhakrishnan, has alleged that there is some "sort of connivance between SDPI and CPI(M)". "The state government acts like the policemen in old Hindi films. There is a sort of connivance between SDPI and CPI(M)," Radhakrishnan said by referring to the alleged murder of an RSS worker on Saturday.

361.title: Pune liquor shop manager killed for refusing to give free alcohol
361.article_body: A 40-year-old liquor shop manager was allegedly murdered in Pune's Vadgaon Budruk after he refused to entertain a demand for free alcohol and money. The 27-year-old accused had reportedly strangulated the manager in a fit of rage after being refused. He was arrested by police the same day and has been booked under relevant sections of the IPC.

362.title: Inform if suspicious activities happen: Police after Jahangirpuri violence
362.article_body: After the violence that took place in Delhi's Jahangirpuri area on Saturday, police have requested people to inform them if any suspicious activities take place in their area or if any group indulges in arguments. “We’ve arrested 14 people, seven cases were filed & weapons were recovered," Dependra Pathak, Delhi’s Special Commissioner of Police, Law & Order, said.

363.title: Pak says its forces facing cross-border attacks from Afghanistan
363.article_body: Pakistan has said there has been a significant increase in cross-border attacks from Afghanistan and that its security forces are being targeted. It added that despite asking the Afghan authorities repeatedly to act against the militants, the attacks continued to take place "with impunity". Meanwhile, Pakistan reportedly conducted air strikes in Afghanistan on Friday, killing  about 40 people.

364.title: Who was 'Mother of Pak' Bilquis Edhi whose death was condoled by PM Modi?
364.article_body: Bilquis Bano Edhi who recently died aged 74 in Pakistan's Karachi was one of the most active philanthropists in the country. Born in Gujarat, Edhi (also known as 'Mother of Pakistan') started a charity that saved over 16,000 unwanted babies in Pakistan. Her foundation had also adopted the specially-abled Indian girl Geeta who wandered into Pakistan when she was 10.

365.title: Govt amends FEMA rules to allow up to 20% FDI in IPO-bound LIC
365.article_body: The government has amended the Foreign Exchange Management Act (FEMA) to allow up to 20% foreign direct investment (FDI) in state-run LIC through the automatic route. "Foreign investment in LIC shall be subject to the provisions of...Life Insurance Corporation Act, 1956," a gazette notification said. The development comes ahead of LIC's IPO, expected to be India's biggest-ever public issue.

366.title: We started this as small Kannada project, only Yash had vision: Director on KGF
366.article_body: KGF Director Prashanth Neel, while talking about the film's success, said that the team never thought that they would be where they are today with the film. "The only person who had this vision was Yash. We started this as a small Kannada project and today the film is really big and the expectations are very high," Prashanth added.

367.title: 4 booked for vandalising 3D cinema screen during 'KGF 2' screening in Guj
367.article_body: Police have booked four unidentified persons for allegedly vandalising a 17-feet 3D screen at a cinema theatre in Gujarat's Vadodara and assaulting the ticket checkers while watching the newly-released film 'KGF: Chapter 2' in a late-night show. The cost of the screen was ₹3.5 lakh. The accused had allegedly occupied seats different from their designated ones in the cinema hall.

368.title: 5 injured in shooting outside mosque in Canada's Toronto
368.article_body: Five people were reportedly injured after unidentified attackers opened fire on a group of people at a parking lot of a mosque in Canada's Toronto on Saturday. The victims were leaving the mosque after Ramzan prayers around midnight. The suspects fled in a blue car after the shooting, said police, adding, it could have been a "random act of violence".

369.title: Teacher uses Heimlich manoeuvre to save choking student in US, video surfaces
369.article_body: A video has surfaced online that captured the moment when a teacher saved a nine-year-old choking student who had accidentally swallowed a bottle cap in the US. It showed the boy attempting to open the water bottle when he started to choke. The teacher performed the Heimlich manoeuvre, an emergency first aid measure for upper airwave obstructions, on the student.

370.title: Rajkummar Rao wraps up shooting for 'HIT - The First Case'
370.article_body: Actor Rajkummar Rao has wrapped up the shoot of his upcoming suspense thriller 'HIT - The First Case'. Taking to his Instagram Story, he shared a picture of a clapboard which read, "It's a wrap". "Can't wait for you guys to watch this," Rajkummar wrote alongside the picture. The Sailesh Kolanu directorial also stars Sanya Malhotra.

371.title: De Villiers will be proud watching Karthik finishing games for RCB: Kohli
371.article_body: While interviewing RCB teammate Dinesh Karthik after their win against DC, Virat Kohli told the wicketkeeper-batter that AB de Villiers will be very proud watching him finishing the games for them. "It was an honour to watch you bat again," added Kohli. Karthik has remained unbeaten in five of their six games and has scored a total of 197 runs.

372.title: Electrician dies after getting electrocuted at Haryana Power Minister's house
372.article_body: A 33-year-old contractual electrician died after being electrocuted while rectifying a fault in a cooler in Haryana Power Minister Ranjit Singh Chautala's house. Police have ruled out any foul play behind the death. A cook in the house saw the electrician become motionless after his head fell in the water-filled cooler, following which she raised an alarm, police said.

373.title: Pressure cooker explodes in Ambala jail, 3 inmates injured
373.article_body: Three inmates sustained burn injuries when a pressure cooker exploded in the Ambala central jail, police said on Saturday. The incident took place when the inmates were cooking a meal in the prison kitchen on Friday night, the cooker burst and splashes of boiling food fell on the inmates, police added. One inmate was sent back after first aid.

374.title: Apprenticeship fair for ITI pass-outs in Noida on Apr 21: Officials
374.article_body: An apprenticeship fair is being organised for ITI pass-outs in Noida on April 21, officials said on Saturday. Forty major companies, including Samsung and Yamaha, are scheduled to participate in the fair that will be held at the ITI in Sector 31, they added. "Interested candidates can participate in the...fair between 10 am and 3 pm," a senior official said.

375.title: We’re not only eliminating rioters but will also end such mentality: MP Minister
375.article_body: The state government has eliminated the rioters from Khargone, MP Minister Vishvas Kailash Sarang said. "Shivraj Singh Chouhan-led government is ensuring that such incidents do not occur again. We are not only eliminating rioters but will also end such mentality," Sarang added. MP CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan has said the state government will rebuild houses damaged by rioters in Khargone.

376.title: Salman ropes in 'Pushpa' music composer DSP for 'Kabhi Eid...': Reports
376.article_body: Music composer Devi Sri Prasad, aka DSP, has reportedly been roped in for Salman Khan's film 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali'. DSP, who composed music for Allu Arjun's 'Pushpa: The Rise', has already started working on the upcoming film, reports stated. "Multiple composers will be working on...music of Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali, with DSP leading it from the front," reports said.

377.title: Policeman gets injured after being shot by criminal in Gurugram
377.article_body: A policeman was injured after a man shot at him in an attempt to try and free his accomplice on Saturday in Gurugram, officials said. Constable Gauri Shankar, who was shot in one of his legs, was rushed to a hospital. The incident took place after Shankar caught hold of one of the two alleged criminals following a chase.

378.title: 40th edition of govt of India's 'Hunar Haat' festival begins in Mumbai
378.article_body: The 40th edition of the Centre's 'Hunar Haat' festival was inaugurated by Union Minister Anurag Thakur in Mumbai on Sunday. The festival, which will conclude on April 27, is aimed at promoting ancestral crafts from remote areas of India. According to the officials, the event has provided employment opportunities to over 9 lakh artisans in a span of 6 years.

379.title: Radio Aksh, India's 1st-ever radio channel for visually impaired launched
379.article_body: 'Radio Aksh', India's first ever radio channel for the visually impaired has been launched in Nagpur. Reports said that educational resources that will have a variety of subjects have been made available through this platform. A team of volunteers helps in creating content for the platform that can be streamed to the visually impaired across India and world.

380.title: Several devotees take part in Karaga festival in B'luru, pics surface
380.article_body: Several devotees took part in the annual Karaga festival in Bengaluru's Thigalarpet on Saturday night. The festival takes place every year during the month of Chaitra at Dharmaraya Swamy Temple. "The festival is celebrated...to mark the return of Draupadi in the form of Adishakti, as she promised at the time of her death," BJP MP Tejasvi Surya said on Twitter.

381.title: Hope the drive was worth it: Karthik on viral 'Drove 1,000 km for RCB' poster
381.article_body: A picture of fans carrying 'Drove 1,000 km for you, RCB!' poster in the stands during RCB's IPL 2022 match against DC went viral. RCB batter-wicketkeeper Dinesh Karthik, who scored an unbeaten 66 off 34 deliveries to help RCB win, reacted to the viral photo. "Hope the drive was worth it," he wrote.

382.title: Before-after pics show damage caused to Mariupol after Russian invasion
382.article_body: Ukraine's Mariupol City Council has shared before and after pictures of the Mariupol railway station to show the damage caused to the city after the Russian invasion. In his recent address, Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said the situation in Mariupol is "inhuman". The Russian troops invaded Mariupol, the strategic port city and a former Soviet state, on February 24.

383.title: Day RCB picked me, Bangar told, 'You'll be playing finisher's role': Karthik
383.article_body: Revealing his role when he was bought by RCB in IPL mega auction 2022, RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik said, "The day I got picked, Sanjay [Bangar] bhai called...told me, 'DK you'll be playing the finisher's role'." Karthik hit 34-ball 66* to help RCB score 189/5 in 20 overs from 92/5 against DC in IPL. RCB won by 16 runs.

384.title: I visited doctor for gym injury in chest, they found the lump: Chhavi on breast cancer
384.article_body: Actress Chhavi Mittal, who recently opened up about her breast cancer diagnosis, took to Instagram to share how the cancer was detected. "I had gone to a doctor for a minor gym injury in the chest and that’s when they found the lump," she said. She added, "We investigated it further and further...till we did a biopsy...which came back positive."

385.title: I want to be a part of T20 World Cup 2022 desperately: Dinesh Karthik
385.article_body: Dinesh Karthik, who scored 66*(34) to help RCB defeat DC, said, "I know there's a World Cup around the corner. I want to be part of that World Cup desperately and help India cross the line." He added, "It's been a long time since India won a multi-nation tournament. I want to be that person who's helping India do that."

386.title: Gang using drones to smuggle heroin from Pakistan busted in Punjab
386.article_body: Three people have been arrested on Saturday as Punjab's Tarn Taran police busted a gang that was allegedly using drones to smuggle heroin from Pakistan. The accused claimed they sent drones across the border with sweets and other gifts and anti-national elements would tie heroin consignments during the return, a police official said. The police have also seized two drones.

387.title: Want to record song with Adele, perform live with Taylor Swift: Asees Kaur
387.article_body: Singer Asees Kaur, who sang the song 'Raataan Lambiyan' for 'Shershaah', said that she wants to record a song with English singer-songwriter Adele. "I really want to sing a song with her and release it," she added. Asees further said she also wants to perform with American singer Taylor Swift on stage. "It's a dream," said Asees.

388.title: Doesn't seem like CSK are going for replacement for Chahar: Jaffer
388.article_body: Wasim Jaffer, speaking about Deepak Chahar's injury, said, "It doesn't seem like CSK are going for a replacement." "Now that you've already invested three matches in Mukesh Choudhary so they want to try and stick with him," he added. Chahar was ruled out of IPL 2022 after suffering from a back injury while recovering from a quadriceps tear at NCA.

389.title: KL Rahul fined ₹12 lakh for slow over-rate against MI
389.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants (LSG) captain KL Rahul has been penalised after his team maintained a slow over-rate during their IPL 2022 match against Mumbai Indians (MI) on Saturday. As it was LSG's first offence of the season relating to over-rate, Rahul was fined ₹12 lakh, the IPL said. LSG defeated MI by 18 runs.

390.title: Man sets world record for watching 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' 292 times
390.article_body: Ramiro Alanis, a resident of US' Florida, has set the Guinness World Record for the most cinema productions attended of the same film after watching 'Spider-Man: No Way Home' 292 times. Ramiro previously achieved this record in 2019 after watching 'Avengers: Endgame' 191 times but it was broken in 2021 by Arnaud Klein who watched 'Kaamelott: First Instalment' 204 times.

391.title: UP exemplary in dealing with violence: Minister on Delhi violence
391.article_body: Uttar Pradesh government has been exemplary in dealing with cases of violence, UP Cabinet Minister Nand Gopal Gupta said on Sunday regarding the incident of violence in Delhi's Jahangirpuri. “Those indulging in violence have been dealt with sternly and will be dealt with sternly," Gupta said. I don't think anyone has the...daring to indulge in violence in UP," he added.

392.title: Mitchell Marsh was the villain: Kris Srikkanth on DC's defeat vs RCB
392.article_body: Former India batter Kris Srikkanth termed DC all-rounder Mitchell Marsh "villain" in his team's 16-run defeat against RCB. He added that Marsh created pressure for DC by scoring 14 runs off 24 deliveries. "Come on Mitch, you should have thought it out or just retired out," he added.

393.title: Twitter board may be concerned about other bidders: Musk on 'poison pill' move
393.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk said the Twitter board might have adopted the shareholder rights plan, or 'poison pill', out of concern about "other potential bidders" than just him. Musk was replying to a tweet saying the board has rejected Musk's offer to buy Twitter "20% above market value" by adopting the defensive strategy and also "threatened" to dilute shareholders' stake.

394.title: India have Pant, Rahul as keepers, Karthik can play T20Is as batter: Doull
394.article_body: Ex-NZ pacer Simon Doull has said RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik should be included in India's squad for the T20 WC in Australia as a backup batter. "India have got Rishabh Pant and KL Rahul as the backup keeper...maybe [Karthik] now goes into the team as a backup batter. He can bat at number six or seven...even number five," stated Doull.

395.title: SRH to bowl first against PBKS, Mayank Agarwal out due to injury
395.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson won the toss and elected to bowl first against PBKS in their IPL 2022 match on Sunday. PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal is not playing the match due to injury, with Shikhar Dhawan leading the side in his absence. Prabhsimran Singh has replaced Mayank Agarwal in PBKS' playing XI.

396.title: Alia Bhatt, Ranbir Kapoor send cake for media at post-wedding party
396.article_body: Newlyweds Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor hosted a post-wedding party at their house on Saturday following their intimate wedding ceremony on April 14. The couple did not make an appearance, however, they sent cakes for the media persons waiting outside their Vastu residence. The party was attended by Shah Rukh Khan, Gauri Khan, Karan Johar and Tara Sutaria among others.

397.title: Muslims should understand that religion isn't bigger than law: Raj Thackeray
397.article_body: Amid loudspeaker row, MNS chief Raj Thackeray said that no one has opposed the offering of prayers. "Muslims should understand that religion isn't bigger than the law. After May 3, I'll see what to do," Raj added. "We don't want riots in Maharashtra...But if you (Muslims) do it on loudspeaker, then we'll also use loudspeakers for it," Raj stated.

398.title: BJP MLA booked for threatening alleged live-in partner in Navi Mumbai
398.article_body: Navi Mumbai Police has registered a case against BJP MLA from Airoli Ganesh Naik after a 47-year-old woman, who claimed to be in a relationship with him, alleged he threatened her. She said they were in a relationship for 27 years and had a son. She alleged that Naik threatened to kill her and himself by showing a revolver.

399.title: Punjab CM, ministers to visit Delhi govt schools, mohalla clinics
399.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann and the members of his Cabinet will reportedly visit government schools and mohalla clinics in Delhi on Monday. Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, who is expected to accompany them, had said the ministers will be shown the "remarkable improvement" achieved by the AAP government. Notably, the Opposition has criticised AAP for running Punjab government through "remote control".

400.title: Pune's PMPML to run free Punyadasham bus services on April 19
400.article_body: Pune Mahanagar Parivahan Mahamandal Limited (PMPML) will celebrate its 15th anniversary on April 19 (Tuesday) and it'll provide free Punyadasham bus services for all citizens on that day. Other bus fares will be ₹5 or ₹10, PMPML said. "PMPML encourages all citizens of Pune, Pimpri and Chinchwad to join our joy by using public transport on this day," it added.
